thread.title: Roberts; Death threats to Boulder Creek administrators? Get a grip, people

title: Roberts; Death threats to Boulder Creek administrators? Get a grip, people
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Roberts: Death threats to Boulder Creek administrators? Get a grip, people Well, you knew this was coming straight at the Boulder Creek administrators who parodied Donald Trump: death threats. Post to Facebook Roberts: Death threats to Boulder Creek administrators? Get a grip, people Well, you knew this was coming straight at the Boulder Creek administrators who parodied Donald Trump: death threats. Check out this story on azcentral.com: http://azc.cc/2ktBhmp Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 1 Laurie Roberts , The Republic | azcentral.com Published 10:16 a.m. MT Jan. 25, 2017 | Updated 5 hours ago 30 Shares 
Well, you knew this was coming though I hoped, for once, that sanity might prevail. 
Nope. 
The Boulder Creek High School administrators who landed in hot water after performing a skit that parodied Donald Trump are now getting death threats. 
It seems the decision by Principal Lauren Sheahan and Assistant Principal/Athletic Director Jay Kopas to play Trump and Kellyanne Conway t o kick off a faculty meeting last week not only wasn’t terribly funny but demonstrates that they are terribly unfit to walk this earth. 
The internet can be a wonderful thing. It makes the world a smaller place and connects us so that we can better understand those who may have differing views from ours. It gives each of us a voice, so that people of goodwill may come together and share viewpoints in the spirit of mutual respect, in the hope of discovering common grou…. 
….Oh, who am I kidding? 
Social media has transformed the internet into a weapon, an instrument of targeted destruction. 
It is not enough, apparently, that I might disagree with you. It seems, of late, that if we disagree then you must die. 
It is not enough, apparently, to shake your head and wonder at the things people do. It seems, of late, that if they offend us then they must pay. 
They must be shamed, scorned and sentenced within minutes of the offense becoming public. 
And yeah, likely lose their jobs because a bunch of school bureaucrats are quivering at the attention turned their way. 
I’d like to say this story ends with the pair of them getting off with a short suspension for a demonstrated lack of better judgment and allowed to keep their day jobs. (Because clearly, they have no future in late-night comedy.) 
I’d like to say the administration will stand up to bullies and respond with something proportional to the act. (It is clear bad judgment, after all, these days to think that we can laugh at, well, anything.) 
I’d like to, but I don’t hold out much hope. 
Meanwhile, the administrators are getting death threats both online and, at least in the case of one of them, at home. 
Imagine for a moment what it must be like to pick up your home phone and field a threat to you and your family because you dared to parody Donald Trump and in jest, called parents “morons.”. 
What are we doing, America? Read or Share this story: http://azc.cc/2ktBhmp Most Popular
